title: Archives Analytics Arbiter

dimensions.label: Schema & Grain Design
dimensions.description: Clarity and suitability of fact/dim schema, grain, and relationships.

bands.label: Confused
bands.criteria: Schemas are vague or inconsistent; grain is unclear. Mixes multiple grains in a single fact table.

bands.label: Reasonable
bands.criteria: Provides a plausible schema with some minor gaps. Fact and dimension tables exist but some grains are underspecified.

bands.label: Deliberate
bands.criteria: Defines a coherent schema with explicit grain and relationships. Clearly states grain for each fact table. Dimensions and hierarchies well chosen.

dimensions.label: Performance & Scaling
dimensions.description: How queries, partitioning, and indexing are handled for scale.

bands.label: Naive
bands.criteria: Barely considers performance or large data volumes. Relies on full-table scans by default.

bands.label: Aware
bands.criteria: Mentions performance tactics but without a full strategy. Suggests partitioning or clustering but not where or how.

bands.label: Intentional
bands.criteria: Outlines a concrete performance strategy tied to usage patterns. Defines partitioning and clustering keys with rationale.

dimensions.label: Quality & Governance
dimensions.description: Strength of testing, validation, ownership, and metric governance.

bands.label: Fragile
bands.criteria: Quality and governance are mostly implicit or missing. Little or no mention of tests or checks.

bands.label: Guarded
bands.criteria: Introduces tests and ownership but leaves gaps. Mentions dbt-style tests or constraints but not how they gate deploys.

bands.label: Governed
bands.criteria: Defines a robust quality and governance model. Specifies concrete tests (uniqueness, referential, thresholds) and what happens when they fail.

dimensions.label: Incidents & Recovery
dimensions.description: How well incidents are detected, debugged, and resolved without making things worse.

bands.label: Hopeful
bands.criteria: Assumes things will mostly work; little incident planning. No clear plan for failed loads or corrupted data.

bands.label: Reactive
bands.criteria: Describes incident handling but incompletely. Explains some steps to debug broken dashboards.

bands.label: Prepared
bands.criteria: Provides concrete runbooks and blast-radius control. Defines how incidents are detected and triaged. Describes safe rollback/backfill strategies.

grade_bands.label: B
grade_bands.description: Functional but has significant gaps in reliability or safety.

autofail_conditions: Designing purely for ad-hoc queries with no schema structure.
llm_judge_instructions: Evaluate the Analytics Architecture Blueprint. Focus on the practicality for a production warehouse. Be strict about specific schema definitions (fact/dim) and testing strategies.
